title: Fighter jets to Rs 1L cr youth employment push - 10 key announcements by PM Modi
content: Prime Minister Modi addressed the nation on Independence Day, outlining initiatives for energy independence, domestic semiconductor production, and GST reforms. He introduced the PM Viksit Bharat Rojgar Yojana to boost job creation and emphasized prioritizing farmers' interests. Modi also warned against nuclear threats and criticized the Indus Waters Treaty, vowing to protect India's interests.

title: Independence Day: Rahul, Kharge absent from Red Fort event; BJP questions no-show
content: The BJP criticized Rahul Gandhi and Mallikarjun Kharge for not attending the Independence Day celebration at the Red Fort. Amit Malviya, BJP I-T cell chief, questioned Gandhi's absence and commitment to national events, also noting his disoriented appearance at the Congress HQ. He further emphasized that such absence sends a poor message about his commitment to national occasions.

title: Exclusive | Parents' sleepless nights, coding, and chess: India gets 89th GM in Rohith
content: Rohith Krishna S, a 19-year-old from Chennai, has become India's 89th Grandmaster, achieving his final GM norm at the Almaty Region Open. His journey, fueled by family support and sacrifices, involved countless hours of practice and international tournaments. Rohith now balances chess with his computer science studies, setting his sights on a 2600 rating and ultimately, the world championship.

title: I-Day in Melbourne disrupted: Indians come face to face with Khalistan 'goons' - video
content: Independence Day celebrations at the Indian consulate in Melbourne faced disruption from Khalistani protesters, but attendees countered with patriotic songs. The consul general hoisted the flag amidst calls to strengthen India-Australia ties. This incident follows other Khalistani-linked activities in Australian cities, including temple vandalism and attacks on Indian students, raising concerns and prompting monitoring by local authorities.

title: FASTag Annual Pass goes live: How to activate, eligibility, trips allowed
content: The Ministry of Road Transport and Highways introduced the FASTag Annual Pass on August 15, 2025, for private vehicles. This pass allows 200 free trips or one year of unlimited passage on National Highways and Expressways. Users can activate it through the Rajmargyatra app or NHAI website for ₹3,000, and it's optional, with regular FASTag usage remaining available.

title: Mahindra unveils 4 new concept SUVs, launch timeline revealed: Details
content: Mahindra & Mahindra unveiled its future SUV strategy, showcasing the NU_IQ platform and four concept vehicles as part of its Vision 2027 plan. Production models based on the NU_IQ platform, designed for versatile powertrain options and enhanced interior space, are expected to launch in 2027.

title: Trump tariff impact: India faces hard choices, says GTRI; warns of $50 bn export hit
content: India faces a strategic dilemma as the US imposes a 50% tariff on most Indian goods, potentially costing India $50 billion. Options include negotiation, retaliation, export diversification, or offering concessions like halting Russian oil imports. Bilateral trade talks continue despite the dispute, with aims to significantly increase trade by 2030.

title: MS Dhoni's seven-word message: 'Consider me as retired'
content: Five years ago, MS Dhoni, India's celebrated captain and wicketkeeper, retired from international cricket, marking the end of an era. His leadership led India to victories in the T20 World Cup (2007), the ODI World Cup (2011), and the Champions Trophy (2013), making him the only captain to win all three major ICC white-ball trophies.

title: Tension over ‘big money’: Existing staff upset; ‘It’s like Meta CEO...’
content: Meta's aggressive AI talent acquisition, spearheaded by Mark Zuckerberg, is causing internal strife. High compensation packages offered to external hires have sparked resentment among existing AI teams, who feel undervalued. Despite significant investment in AI infrastructure, Meta's models still trail competitors, leading to a divided company with uncertain roles for many employees.

title: ‘Senior terrorist eliminated’: IDF says Hamas military control dept head killed
content: The IDF announced the killing of Nasser Moussa, a senior Hamas figure, in an airstrike in southern Gaza. Moussa, responsible for training and operations, was a close associate of a previously eliminated commander. The IDF also targeted rocket storage sites. Amid ongoing military actions, a deepening humanitarian crisis unfolds in Gaza, with rising casualties and accusations of restricted aid.

title: 'Glorifying RSS an insult to freedom struggle': Owaisi criticises PM Modi's speech
content: Asaduddin Owaisi has strongly criticized Prime Minister Narendra Modi for praising the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) during his Independence Day speech. Owaisi described Modi's glorification of the RSS as an insult to the freedom struggle, accusing the organization of not participating in the independence movement and opposing Mahatma Gandhi.

title: Jamie Dimon on US-China tech race: Calls reliance on China ‘embarrassing’
content: The Nvidia H20 chip sales to China are under scrutiny. This has intensified the US-China tech rivalry. Jamie Dimon warns about US vulnerability. He points out dependence on China for essential goods. Chinese regulators question Nvidia chip purchases. They are pushing for domestic alternatives. Nvidia denies security risks. China is asking tech firms to reconsider Nvidia orders.

title: ‘Rs 15,000 in 1st pvt job': PM Modi unveils Viksit Bharat Rozgar Yojana; what the scheme offers
content: Prime Minister Modi introduced the PM Viksit Bharat Rozgar Yojana on Independence Day, effective from August 1, 2025. This initiative aims to generate 3.5 crore jobs in two years, with a focus on first-time job seekers. The scheme provides incentives for both employees and employers to boost hiring and economic growth, with a substantial budget allocated for its implementation.

title: 'Your country enjoys well-deserved respect': Putin wishes PM Modi on I-Day
content: On India's Independence Day, Russia extended warm greetings to President Droupadi Murmu and Prime Minister Narendra Modi, acknowledging India's significant achievements across various sectors. Vladimir Putin emphasized the strategic partnership between the two nations and expressed eagerness to broaden bilateral cooperation. This message arrives amidst US tariff threats and geopolitical tensions, highlighting the enduring bond between Russia and India.

title: ‘Biggest NGO in the world’: PM Modi hails RSS in I-Day speech
content: On the 79th Independence Day, Prime Minister Narendra Modi praised the Rashtriya Swayamsevak Sangh (RSS) from the Red Fort, acknowledging its century of service to the nation. He hailed the RSS as the world's largest NGO, emphasizing its dedication to nation-building and welfare.

title: Watch: 2 BJP MLAs clash inside UP assembly; Akhilesh shares viral video
content: A video capturing a heated argument between BJP lawmakers Rajesh Chaudhary and Saurabh Srivastava during the Uttar Pradesh assembly's monsoon session has gone viral. The clash erupted when Chaudhary, representing Mathura, was denied his allocated speaking time due to extended speeches by others. Srivastava, acting as chief whip, engaged in a verbal exchange with Chaudhary, prompting intervention from other members.

title: 'Greed for money stands above sacrifice': Aaditya Thackeray on India vs Pakistan
content: Aaditya Thackeray has strongly criticised the BCCI for prioritising financial interests over national sentiment by agreeing to play against Pakistan in the Asia Cup. This follows the Pahalgam terror attack and Operation Sindoor. Thackeray questioned the BCCI's decision, highlighting Prime Minister Modi's warning against any enemy misadventures.

title: PM Modi announces task force to consider next-gen reforms - What will it do?
content: PM Modi unveiled plans for major economic reforms. A task force will be formed to modernise laws. The goal is to boost self-reliance and economic growth. The task force will revise existing laws. It will reduce burdens on businesses. Next-generation GST reforms are coming. These reforms will lower taxes on everyday items. The changes aim to benefit citizens directly.

title: Nagpur guitar teacher rapes 17-year-old at gunpoint; held
content: In Nagpur, a 17-year-old student was allegedly repeatedly raped and blackmailed at gunpoint by her guitar teacher, Sagar Singh Parosiya, over two months. He threatened her and her family, forcing her to his apartment. Police arrested Parosiya and recovered a sword from his residence, adding charges under the Arms Act and POCSO Act.

title: Flash floods in Pak: Widespread destruction reported; at least 49 killed in north-west
content: Heavy rains have triggered devastating flash floods in north-western Pakistan and other regions, resulting in at least 49 deaths in the last 24 hours. Since late June, over 360 people, predominantly women and children, have perished in rain-related incidents nationwide. Pak-occupied Gilgit-Baltistan and Khyber Pakhtunkhwa provinces have been particularly hard-hit, with numerous casualties and significant infrastructure damage reported.

title: Kishtwar cloudburst: 60 dead, over 100 injured; PM Modi assures all help to J&K CM
content: Following the devastating cloudburst in Kishtwar's Chasoti village, which resulted in 60 fatalities and over 100 injuries, Prime Minister Modi has assured Jammu and Kashmir of full support. The disaster, occurring during the Machail Mata Yatra, caused widespread destruction. Rescue operations are ongoing, with helpline numbers established to aid those affected by the floods.

title: 10 dead, 35 injured as Bihar-bound bus rams into truck in West Bengal's Burdwan
content: A tragic accident in West Bengal's Burdwan district claimed the lives of at least 10 people and left 35 injured. A passenger bus collided with a stationary truck on National Highway 19 near Nala Ferry Ghat around 7 am on Friday. Rescue teams promptly responded, transporting the injured to nearby hospitals.

title: 'War 2' box office collection (Live): Hrithik, Jr NTR and Kiara starrer chases Rs 100 cr
content: YRF's 'War 2,' starring Hrithik Roshan and Jr NTR, debuted strongly but faces stiff competition. The action sequel earned an estimated Rs 52.50 crore on day one, boosted by the Telugu version. However, Hindi openings lagged behind other Spy Universe films. Rajinikanth's 'Coolie' poses a significant challenge, earning impressive figures.

title: Big GST cheer for common man! 2-slab tax structure to replace 5-28% rates; key details shared by govt
content: Prime Minister Modi announced upcoming GST reforms aimed at easing the burden on citizens, farmers, and MSMEs. The proposed changes include a simplified two-slab structure and rate rationalization. These reforms focus on structural improvements, rate adjustments, and enhancing the ease of living, with implementation expected this financial year.

title: Cristiano Ronaldo to play in India? Al Nassr drawn with FC Goa in AFC Champions League Two
content: Cristiano Ronaldo's Al Nassr has been drawn alongside FC Goa in the AFC Champions League Two group stage, raising hopes of the Portuguese star playing in India. However, his appearance is uncertain due to contract conditions regarding away travel. Mohun Bagan Super Giant too, will participate in the competition, adding to the excitement for Indian football fans.

title: MP principal booked for molesting; hugged class 7 girl to ‘relieve depression’
content: In Vidisha district, a government school principal faces charges under the POCSO Act for allegedly attempting to hug a class 7 student, claiming it would alleviate his "depression." The incident, which occurred on July 26, surfaced after the girl reported it on August 11, alleging threats from the principal to remain silent about the ordeal.

title: FASTag annual pass launch: Steps to activate Rs 3,000 pass easily; key benefits, FAQs
content: The National Highways Authority of India (NHAI) will launch the FASTag Annual Pass on August 15, 2025, priced at Rs 3,000 for private vehicles. This pass allows up to 200 trips on designated National Highways and Expressways or is valid for one year. Activation is through the Rajmarg Yatra app or NHAI website, simplifying toll payments for frequent travelers.

title: Watch: Manu Bhaker marks Independence Day with violin tribute
content: Olympic medalist Manu Bhaker celebrated India's 79th Independence Day by sharing a video of herself playing the national anthem on the violin. The accomplished shooter expressed her deep desire to stand on the podium, listening to the anthem, every time she represents India. Bhaker's impressive career includes Olympic medals, World Championship wins, and success at the Commonwealth and Asian Games.

title: 'Infiltrators snatching bread & butter': PM announces demographic mission on I-Day
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, addressing the nation on Independence Day, warned of a premeditated conspiracy to alter India's demography through illegal infiltration. He asserted that these "ghuspaithiyas" pose a threat by snatching opportunities from the youth, targeting women, and encroaching on tribal lands. Modi announced a high-powered demographic mission to tackle this crisis within a set timeframe.

title: CBSE warns against fake agents: Bogus document services flagged; students told to stay vigilant
content: The Central Board of Secondary Education (CBSE) has warned students, parents, and stakeholders against fraudulent agents falsely claiming to offer quick services for duplicate mark sheets, certificates, and record corrections. CBSE clarified such operators are unauthorised and urged reliance only on its official website, stressing it will not be liable for losses from third-party dealings.

title: 'Kehna kya chahte ho?': Shashi Tharoor’s punny reply leaves internet in splits
content: Shashi Tharoor, known for his impressive vocabulary, responded humorously to a social media user's deliberately complex comment regarding US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent's description of India as "recalcitrant" in trade negotiations. Tharoor defended India's approach, stating it's better to be recalcitrant than submissive to injustice, amidst rising trade tensions and new tariffs imposed by the US.

title: Independence Day: 'Country's demography is being changed'- Top quotes from PM's speech
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi addressed the nation from the Red Fort on the 79th Independence Day, marking his 12th consecutive address. He paid tribute to Mahatma Gandhi and hoisted the flag, emphasising the theme of 'Naya Bharat' and the vision of 'Viksit Bharat' by 2047. Modi saluted the armed forces and highlighted India's stance against nuclear threats, referencing actions taken after the Pahalgam attack.

title: 85+ Happy Independence Day messages, greetings, wishes & quotes
content: India gears up to celebrate its 79th Independence Day in 2025, commemorating freedom achieved on August 15, 1947. The nation will honour its history through flag-hoisting, parades, and cultural events. Citizens are encouraged to share patriotic wishes, messages, and quotes on social media, reflecting on sacrifices made and reaffirming commitment to unity and progress.

title: 'Daam kam, dum zyada': PM’s strong pitch amid tariff war; big 'Make in India' push on I-Day
content: From the Red Fort, Prime Minister Modi responded to US tariff threats by championing a self-reliant India, urging focus on high-quality, affordable products with the mantra 'Daam kam, dum zyada.' He emphasised 'vocal for local' to achieve a prosperous India, calling on influencers and political parties to promote indigenous products and build a stronger global image through commitment and quality.

title: 'The time has come': Stalin urges legal battle; TN CM calls to reclaim states’ powers
content: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin, in his Independence Day address, urged citizens to reject bigotry and protect the marginalized. He accused the Centre of usurping states' powers in key sectors like education and creating financial dependencies through biased policies. Stalin emphasized the need for political and legal battles to protect states' rights and financial shares, advocating for true federalism.

title: Happy Krishna Janmashtami 2025: Best messages, quotes and images to share
content: Janmashtami, celebrating Lord Krishna's birth, will be observed on August 15 and 16. Festivities include temple decorations, midnight prayers, and the Dahi Handi tradition. Devotees focus on Krishna's teachings of love, duty, and inner awakening, sharing wishes and images of the celebrations. Homes will be filled with devotion, fasting, and stories of Krishna's life.

title: 1983 World Cup, MS Dhoni's treble and more: India's greatest cricket feats since 1947
content: Since 1947, India's cricket journey has been filled with remarkable milestones, including their first Test win in 1952 and series victory against Pakistan. The 1983 World Cup triumph marked a turning point, while MS Dhoni's leadership secured multiple ICC titles. India's dominance in Test cricket at home and recent victories in major tournaments highlight their enduring legacy.

title: PM Modi promises big Diwali gift! GST reforms to lower tax burden; what he said in I-Day speech
content: Prime Minister Modi announced upcoming GST reforms as a Diwali gift, promising a reduced tax burden. A group of state ministers will meet to discuss potential GST reductions for various products, with some opposing changes due to revenue concerns.

title: India at 79: Google Doodle celebrates India's Independence Day - from cricket to cinema
content: Google celebrated India's 79th Independence Day with a doodle showcasing the nation's artistic diversity and achievements. The artwork, created by Boomranng Studio, features regional art forms like Jaipur blue pottery and terracotta relief work. Tiles symbolize India's progress in space, cricket's unifying power, chess dominance, and the global recognition of Indian cinema, highlighting the country's rich cultural heritage.

title: PM Modi unveils Rs 99,446 cr PM-VBRY; here’s how it aims to boost job sector
content: On Independence Day 2025, PM Narendra Modi launched the ₹99,446 crore PM-VBRY scheme to create 3.5 crore jobs in two years. Offering incentives to both first-time employees and employers, the programme aims to lower hiring costs, formalise jobs, boost workplace mobility, and spur economic growth across sectors, especially in Tier-2 and Tier-3 cities.

title: I-Day 2025: Tiranga, Operation Sindoor banner soar above Red Fort - video
content: India's 79th Independence Day celebrated the success of Operation Sindoor, targeting terror sites in Pakistan and PoK. PM Modi, addressing the nation from Red Fort, asserted India's firm stance against terrorism, vowing to hold Pakistan accountable for any future aggression. He lauded the armed forces for their unprecedented action during Operation Sindoor, setting a new standard in combating cross-border terrorism and avenging the Pahalgam attack.

title: AC coach ‘cooling’ issue turns into liquor haul on Bihar bound train
content: Passengers traveling on the Lucknow-Barauni Express experienced discomfort due to poor AC cooling, leading to a surprising discovery. Railway technicians found 316 whisky bottles hidden in the AC duct of an AC-2 tier coach. A coach attendant was arrested for smuggling the liquor into Bihar, where prohibition laws have created a lucrative black market, concealing the bottles to avoid detection.

title: Answering one key preseason question for 20 NFL teams
content: NFL Nation reporters answer the most important fantasy questions, providing insight from training camps.

title: Sources: NFLPA puts one of top lawyers on leave
content: The NFL Players Association put Heather McPhee, whose allegations helped prompt a federal investigation, on paid administrative leave after multiple employees filed complaints with the union's human resources department, sources said.

title: Browns' Judkins won't face charge for July arrest
content: Prosecutors have declined to file a formal misdemeanor battery charge against Browns rookie running back Quinshon Judkins, a spokesperson for the Broward State Attorney's Office in Florida told ESPN.

title: Bond won't be charged, says he's joining Browns
content: The sexual assault case against former Texas wide receiver Isaiah Bond has been no-billed and he faces no further criminal charges, Collin County (Texas) District Attorney Greg Willis said.

title: Hot-putting MacIntyre takes BMW lead with 62
content: Robert MacIntyre seized on a softer Caves Valley after a two-hour storm delay and rode the best putting round of his year with six straight birdies to post an 8-under 62 for a three-shot lead over Tommy Fleetwood in the BMW Championship on Thursday.

title: Hello again: Durant, Davis returns mark NBA slate
content: The Rockets' Kevin Durant will make his return to Phoenix on Nov. 24, while the Mavs' Anthony Davis will return to L.A. to play the Lakers on Nov. 28.

title: First-place Phillies to use 6 SPs with Nola return
content: Phillies manager Rob Thomson said Thursday that he will utilize a six-man rotation beginning this weekend when Aaron Nola returns from the injured list.

title: Packers' Love: Surgery now so 100% for Week 1
content: Packers quarterback Jordan Love opted to have surgery on his left thumb this week because he didn't want to go into the season with any nagging injuries.

title: Rooney: Brady work ethic criticism was 'unfair'
content: Former Birmingham City manager Wayne Rooney has said Tom Brady's criticism about his work ethic was "unfair."

title: 📷 Mets, Mariners players as Little Leaguers
content: From Cal Raleigh to Juan Soto, here's what players in this year's Little League Classic looked like as Little Leaguers themselves.

title: Arch Manning is finally Texas' starting QB! Coaches and scouts on his expectations and draft status
content: Manning now has the reins of the Longhorns' offense, but what do evaluators think of him entering the season -- and when could he enter the NFL draft?

title: Stacking the best, worst positional groups in the NFL: 1-32 rankings, plus roster outlooks
content: Which team has the best wide receivers? The shakiest edge rusher room? We ranked all 32 teams in 10 position groups.

content: The Premier League's back! Let's predict how each team will finish by assessing how Arsenal, Chelsea, Liverpool, Man United and all the rest look.

title: Week 1 predicted starting XIs: Liverpool, Arsenal, Man City, more
content: After a busy summer of transfers and preseason prep, here's how we expect all the top clubs to line up.

content: Who is rising and falling in every major league farm system after the trade deadline? Kiley McDaniel digs in.

title: 'Last year was abnormal': How Patrick Mahomes raised his game another level for 2025
content: After a crushing Super Bowl LIX loss, Mahomes has wowed teammates and coaches with his accuracy and focus this summer.

title: The Bottom 10 is back! Who will bring up the rear in college football in 2025?

title: Mentality and experience counts: What it's like getting promoted to the Premier League
content: ESPN FC analyst and ex-Man City defender Nedum Onuoha, who won promotion with QPR, reveals how a team prepares for promotion to the Premier League.

content: LeBron will be a free agent next summer. Giannis and Jokic are eligible for massive extensions. But those aren't the only topics we're watching.

title: Eight hot takes for the final month of the WNBA regular season
content: Atlanta will be the 2-seed in the playoffs, Seattle will reach the postseason and not one head coach will get fired.

title: 10 biggest WNBA games that will determine the 2025 playoff race
content: From a Lynx-Liberty showdown to the regular-season finale, these are the most impactful WNBA games left.

title: After suffering a catastrophic injury, can UNC quarterback Max Johnson get his career back on track?
content: The son of Brad Johnson is entering his sixth year of college after rehabbing a broken leg, still hoping that he can play his way into the NFL draft.

title: Taylor talks ball: Highlights from Swift's appearance on 'New Heights' podcast
content: The superstar debuted on Jason and Travis Kelce's "New Heights" podcast, talked about becoming a football fan.

title: How Knicks fans deal with being on MSG's banned list
content: Despite backlash, MSG Entertainment's "attorney exclusion list" is still in effect, reportedly banning over a thousand lawyers since 2022.

title: How Jerry Jones' contract negotiations cost the Cowboys $100M
content: What is going on in Dallas? The Micah Parsons situation is just the latest in a line of costly mistakes.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Barcelona eye Vlahovic as Lewandowski successor
content: Barcelona have been following Juventus striker Dusan Vlahovic's situation closely. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: 2025 NFL betting preview: Three picks to make on your favorite team
content: Will your team beat its projected win total? What props should you target? Here are three bets we like for every NFL team.

title: NFL betting: Eight player props we like to hit the 'over' this season
content: Optimism is the theme, with the "over" bet being a popular play in Liz Loza and Daniel Dopp's "Props that Pop."

title: Police given 'absolute power' to act in cases of crimes against women: Odisha CM Mohan Charan Majhi
content: Addressing the Independence Day function, Mohan Charan Majhi said his government will not hesitate to bring a special legislation to "completely end" organised crimes

title: With Durga Puja 45 days away, Kumartuli going through busiest time in year
content: The iconic north Kolkata neighbourhood is filled with idol makers trying to meet the Puja deadline, and visitors shooting their craftsmanship

title: Shwetha Menon, Kukku Parameswaran create history as first women to lead Malayalam actors’ body AMMA
content: In a keenly contested election, Shwetha Menon and Kukku Parameswaran have been elected president and general secretary, defeating Devan and Raveendran, respectively

title: Four persons suffocated to death in septic tank in Jharkhand’s Garhwa
content: Sub Divisional Officer of Garhwa, Sanjay Kumar, said that it was a newly built septic tank, and the incident happened when one after the other, all four persons entered it to clean planks after removing shutterings

title: ₹98.25-crore Corporation contract irregularities during S.P. Velumani’s tenure: Madras HC questions special court over delay in taking chargesheets on file
content: Justice N. Anand Venkatesh also directs DVAC SP S. Vimala to file an affidavit explaining the delay in obtaining sanction to prosecute public servants

title: PM Modi dishes out poll messaging in Independence Day address
content: PM Modi’s Independence Day speech may have been dominated by economic and policy announcements, but it also had messages for the poll-bound States

title: Telangana CM Revanth Reddy cautions real estate developers against falling for ‘politically motivated rumours’
content: The Chief Minister asserted that even if leadership changes, Telangana always avoided policy paralysis

title: Andhra Pradesh Transco submits final proposal for Green Energy Corridor-III to CEA: JMD Kirti
content: The project was aimed at connecting 11 Gigawatts of solar power and 7,373 Megawatts of Pumped Storage Hydropower Projects to the grid at an estimated cost of ₹28,033 crore

title: Specially-abled students perform national anthem in sign language in Srinagar on Independence Day
content: Some of the students who participated in the function were speech and hearing impaired, while some were visually impaired

title: Top priority being given for health, education, agriculture, housing in Andhra Pradesh
content: Salute to the Armed Forces who showed the power of India during ‘Operation Sindhoor,’ says Andhra Pradesh CM Chandrababu Naidu

title: PM Modi has dishonoured memory of martyrs by praising RSS in I-Day speech: CPI(M)
content: CPI(M) general secretary M.A. Baby said that the RSS was banned following the assassination of Mahatma Gandhi and historians have documented the organisation's role in "inciting communal riots"

title: Residents of Uralagallu stage protest in Sagar demanding ‘freedom’ from lack of basic amenities, including electricity, roads and school
content: Under the banner of Shivamogga Zilla Raitha Sangha, led by Dinesh Shiravala, the residents began the protest in front of the Mahatma Gandhi statue at the office of the Sagar City Municipal Council around 5 p.m. on August 14

title: Assam researchers find fungal formula to produce biodiesel
content: A team of 10 scientists develops a catalyst from post-harvest mushroom waste for clean fuel production from a blend of oils

title: Government contemplating action against those who launched a ‘misinformation campaign’ against Dharmasthala: Karnataka Deputy CM D. K. Shivakumar
content: 16 days of exhumation in Dharmasthala by the Special Investigation Team (SIT) yielded little evidence about mass burial

title: Law and order situation improved, under control in Manipur, says Governor Ajay Kumar Bhalla
content: The Manipur Governor said the northeastern state, which is under President’s Rule, has made remarkable progress across various sectors from social welfare, infrastructure development to economic empowerment

title: Independence Day 2025: Chief Minister Siddaramaiah says Karnataka’s economy is robust, bolstered by guarantees
content: Siddaramaiah said that his government’s guarantee schemes are ‘transforming the trajectory of Karnataka’s development’

title: Fr. Paul Thelakat interview | ‘Bishops failed Catholic community by refusing to listen before making political decisions’
content: In a conversation with The Hindu, former spokesperson of Syro-Malabar Catholic Church in Kerala reflects on the rise of communal narratives within sections of the clergy, socio-economic shifts reshaping Syrian Christian community, and attacks on Christians in north and central Indian States

title: Jammu and Kashmir cloudburst: Survivors recall ‘miraculous’ escape
content: At least 60 people lost their lives when a massive cloudburst led to flash floods in this remote mountain village in Jammu and Kashmir’s Kishtwar district

title: 2019-24 darkest period in Andhra’s history; NDA alliance adopts ‘Unite and Rule’ policy: Deputy CM Pawan Kalyan
content: “Water security will be guaranteed through Jal Jeevan Mission: Forest cover will be increased from 33 to 37% in Andhra Pradesh,” Pawan Kalyan said

title: Actor Jackie Shroff, PETA to gift mechanical elephant to temple in Kerala’s Thrissur
content: A 3-metre-tall, 800-kg mechanical elephant named Thaleeswaran is being donated to the temple in recognition of its commitment to never hire or keep real elephants

title: Independence Day 2025: BJP will go to any extent of immorality to remain in power, alleges Congress President Mallikarjun Kharge
content: The Congress chief says the party cannot let the dreams of Gandhi, Nehru, Patel, Ambedkar, Azad and Bose be “shattered,” urges colleagues to fight their battle against the current regime with the same intensity as the freedom struggle

title: Renukaswamy murder case: Celebrities cannot use their popularity to influence the law, cautions Supreme Court
content: “Popularity cannot be a shield for impunity... Celebrities serve as social role models – accountability is greater, not lesser,” SC warns in Darshan bail case judgment

title: PM Modi announces ‘Sudarshan Chakra’ project to boost defence shield
content: Announcing the launch of "Mission Sudarshan Chakra", the Prime Minister said it will be aimed at neutralising enemy threat and enhancing India's offensive capabilities

title: PM's praise of RSS in I-Day speech troubling, his desperate attempt to appease Sangh: Congress
content: It is nothing but a desperate attempt to appease the organisation in the run-up to his 75th birthday next month, says Congress leader Jairam Ramesh

title: I-Day celebrations | CM Revanth reflects on achievements, plan to transform Telangana
content: Mr. Revanth Reddy said the aim is to make Telangana a $1 trillion economy by 20235 and $3 trillion by 2047

title: Indians need to make sacrifices to keep independence ‘alive’, says RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat
content: The RSS chief said an Independent India too has its duty towards the entire world, which is facing innumerable problems and is unable to overcome them since 2,000 years

title: At least 10 pilgrims from Bihar killed, 35 injured as bus rams into truck in West Bengal's Burdwan
content: The pilgrims, who belonged to Motihari in Bihar's East Champaran district, were returning home after visiting Gangasagar in South 24 Parganas district

title: Madras High Court orders inspection of Amrita Vishwa Vidyapeetham campus run by Mata Amritanandamayi Math
content: Justices N. Sathish Kumar and D. Bharatha Chakravarthy direct the District Forest Officer to inspect the Ettimadai campus along with the amici curiae

title: Will launch door-to-door signature campaign for J&K Statehood: CM Omar Abdullah
content: Abdullah said it is unfortunate that people of the region are being punished for a crime in which they played no role

title: Farmers, yoga volunteers special guests for PM’s address on Independence Day
content: Farmers are the backbone of our nation, and yoga experts continue to guide us towards health, harmony, and inner strength, says Union Minister of State for Health and Family Welfare, Prataprao Jadhav

title: Water level of River Yamuna breaches the ‘warning level’ of 204.5 metres

title: PM used Independence Day speech to target 'new enemy' in form of infiltrators: TMC
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, in his speech on India's 79th Independence Day, warned people of a premeditated conspiracy to change the country's demography through illegal infiltration

title: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan warns of threats to sovereignty and social harmony in Independence Day address
content: Leading Kerala’s 79th Independence Day celebrations, Pinarayi Vijayan says national achievements in science and technology should not overshadow lived realities of marginalised sections

title: In his longest-ever Independence Day speech, PM Modi emphasises self-reliance, self-respect; warns of attempt to change India’s demography
content: Independence Day address, under the shadow of U.S. President Donald Trump’s tariffs, peppered with announcements of economic and other reforms, mission to check “conspiracy to change demography”, changes in GST by Diwali

title: Banke Bihari temple: Why does the Uttar Pradesh govt wants to take over the 150-year old Krishna shrine?

title: Semiconductors Complex Ltd in Chandigarh started operations in 1983: Congress on PM's swipe

title: India to launch demographic mission to tackle illegal infiltration: PM Modi in Independence Day speech

title: Major attack on Independence Day thwarted in Tripura as police arrest 2 with explosives

title: PM Independence Day speech: Modi is standing like a wall against any harmful policy related to farmers, fishermen and cattle rearers
content: The remarks are important as the U.S. is seeking duty concessions from India in agriculture and dairy sectors in the proposed bilateral trade agreement (BTA), being negotiated between the two countries

title: 44-year-old man stabs parents to death in Kerala’s Alappuzha
content: Though the accused left the house after committing the double murder, the police soon nabbed him. Police said the accused committed the murders while under the influence of alcohol

title: NIMHANS to organise workshop on ‘Immediate Care for Psychological Events and Emergencies’ in Bengaluru
content: NIMHANS has designed this workshop specifically for common people, even those without a behavioural science background

title: At the crossroads: on TCS layoffs
content: The recent announcement of TCS that it would be releasing 2% of its global workforce has sent shockwaves across the 20 lakh IT/ITeS workforce in Karnataka. Many feel that what is happening at TCS is an indication of bigger disruptions to come. Shilpa Elizabeth looks at the challenges faced by the employees and the industry, which blames the advent of AI for the downtrend

title: When water scorches the earth
content: Over one lakh coconut trees have died over the past six years in the Central Godavari Delta as saline backwaters from a once-life giving watercourse poisons soil in nine villages. The man-made disaster has crippled lives and paralysed local economies and threatens to tear asunder an age-old bond between people and a vital crop, writes T. Appala Naidu

title: PM Modi I-Day speech: India achieves clean energy target 5 years ahead of schedule, says Modi
content: India has achieved its ambitious climate target of having 50% of its cumulative installed electricity capacity from non-fossil-based sources five years ahead of schedule, says the Prime Minister

title: Bribe and prejudice: when graft charges slip through the cracks in Telangana
content: In Telangana, instances of officers getting caught taking a bribe may spark a scandal, but it is rarely a career-ender. Bureaucratic delays, alleged shoddy investigations and ‘political shielding’ drag cases to a crawl. Many accused officers not only return to their posts but climb the ranks, while prosecutions fade into obscurity. The result? A system that claims to fight graft but too often shields the corrupt. Lavpreet Kaur exposes how anti-corruption cases end without a sense of justice

title: Forest Advisory Committee defers Sharavathi PSP proposal by KPCL, seeks clarifications on tree cutting
content: It referred to the recommendations of the Standing Committee of the National Board of Wildlife in its meeting held in June and asked the status of compliance

title: Former APSRTC Chairman predicts imprisonment for Jagan in liquor scam
content: Accusing Mr. Jagan of fearing the CBI, he questioned why the former Chief Minister met jailed YSRCP leaders in the liquor scam but not the arrested officials

title: PM Modi I-Day speech: India working towards having its own space station, says Modi
content: The Prime Minister said India is working on becoming self-reliant in the space sector as well, and is preparing for launch of Gaganyaan

title: The State of Madras broke into unbounded joy a day before independence in 1947
content: From Mount Road to the lanes of Mylapore, the air was filled with the sound of drums, conchs, and patriotic songs. The Corporation of Madras started making arrangements nearly two weeks before the ceremonial transfer of power. The Mayor appealed to citizens to whitewash their houses and decorate them in the best manner possible

title: How traders welcomed Free India
content: On the morning of August 15, merchants and chambers of commerce joined the celebrations. Traders placed interesting advertisements on the pages of The Hindu, which were brimming with tributes, patriotic appeal, and writings of leaders

title: How Tamil cinema plunged into freedom movement after the advent of talkies
content: Theatre personalities entered the film world, carrying their ardent support for the cause of Indian independence. Though censorship remained a challenge for them, the Government of India Act, 1935, and the election of C. Rajagopalachari as the Prime Minister of the Madras Presidency in 1937 helped them in their endeavour

title: How India's Choice Of August 15 As Independence Day Has A Japan Link
content: Amid rising communal violence and worsening law and order, the British Parliament decided that the colonial rule in India would end on August 15, 1947.

title: Chandrababu Naidu Launches Statewide Free Bus Travel Scheme For Women

content: At least 46 people died, including two Central Industrial Security Force (CISF) personnel, after a massive cloudburst struck Chashoti village in Jammu and Kashmir's Kishtwar district on Thursday.

title: Boy Killed, Many Injured In Cylinder Blast In Bengaluru, 6 Houses Damaged

title: Trump-Putin Alaska Meet: Hotels, Cabs Booked Out, Temporary Curbs On Flights

title: This Whale Species Was Smaller Than A Bed. Fossil Found On Australia Beach
content: A chance discovery of a 25 million-year-old fossil on an Australian beach has allowed paleontologists to identify a rare, entirely new species that could unlock mysteries of whale evolution.

title: Trump's Alaska Summit With Putin Most Important In His Second Presidency
content: The White House, and Trump himself, have played down expectations of an imminent breakthrough towards peace in Ukraine, claiming that this would be "a feel-out meeting" to determine whether a ceasefire is possible.

content: US President Donald Trump is meeting face-to-face with Russian President Vladimir Putin in Alaska on Friday for a high-stakes summit that could determine not only the trajectory of the war in Ukraine but also the fate of European security.

title: Gaganyaan Loading... Shubhanshu Shukla To Be Back In India Soon
content: India's 21st-century space hero, astronaut Group Captain Shubhanshu Shukla, is on his way back to India. Mr Shukla spent 18 days at the International Space Station on the Axiom 4 commercial space mission.

title: "Won't Be Intimidated": Trump Ahead Of Key Alaska Meet With Putin
content: US President Donald Trump insisted Thursday he would not be intimidated by Russian leader Vladimir Putin on the eve of a high-stakes summit and said Ukraine would be involved in any deal on its fate.

title: Shopkeepers Should Put Up Boards Promoting Swadeshi Products: PM Modi

title: World's First Humanoid Robot Games Begin In China
content: The world's first-ever humanoid robot games began Friday in Beijing, with over 500 androids alternating between jerky tumbles and glimpses of real power as they compete in events from the 100-metre hurdles to kung fu.

title: Plastic Pollution Treaty Talks Collapse Without An Agreement
content: Talks aimed at striking a landmark global treaty on plastic pollution fell apart Friday without agreement, as countries failed to find consensus on how the world should tackle the ever-growing scourge.

title: 49 Killed In Flash Floods Triggered By Heavy Rain In Pakistan
content: Flash floods triggered by heavy rains killed at least 49 people in Pakistan over the past 24 hours, officials said Friday, as rescuers evacuated 1,300 stranded tourists from a mountainous district hit by landslides.
